cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving westward, forecast to turn WNW tonight and come ashore on the southeast Florida coast, then curve northwest across the Florida Peninsula into southern Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast coast of Florida near Palm Beach/Boca Raton area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to Boca Raton, FL (includes Port Everglades/Fort Lauderdale)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach to Boca Raton, FL (tropical-storm warning); hurricane warning north of Boca Raton to Flagler/Volusia county line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the southeast Florida coast, northward to Georgia and South Carolina, and the northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) expected; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible along the coast from Hallandale Beach northward, including Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches widespread with local maxima near 8 inches over southeast Florida, producing flash and urban flooding potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible tonight through Thursday; dangerous surf and rip currents likely to disrupt port operations.
